qas.question: Who is the Bronx named for?

answers.text: created the first settlement as part of the New Netherland colony

qas.question: When did Bronck settle in the New York area?
What native tribe lived in the New York area?
What types of music the Bronx famous for?

context: The Bronx is named after <a0_0>Jonas Bronck<a0_0/> who <a1_0>created the first settlement as part of the New Netherland colony<a1_0/> in <a2_0>1639<a2_0/>. The native <a3_0>Lenape<a3_0/> were displaced after 1643 by settlers. In the 19th and 20th centuries, the Bronx received many immigrant groups as it was transformed into an urban community, first from various European countries (particularly Ireland, Germany and Italy) and later from the Caribbean region (particularly Puerto Rico, Jamaica and the Dominican Republic), as well as African American migrants from the American South. This cultural mix has made the Bronx a wellspring of both <a4_0>Latin music and hip hop<a4_0/>.
